inn1.comm: Panyangara starts with a full length delivery that curves in towards middle and leg, Porterfield nudging it gently out to the square leg fielder inside the ring
this one holds its line outside off, the Ireland captain raising his bat out of harm's way to let the ball through
Well, there's definitely bounce and carry through to the keeper first up. Again Panyangara hits a length outside off, and Porterfield shoulders arms to the rising delivery
the bowler goes a little fuller on the same line, Porterfield pressing forward but aiming his checked drive straight at Raza at extra cover
Panyangara adjusts his length to rule out the drive, but sticks to the same line on or around off stump. This one is dead-batted towards point.
no dead bat this time! Panyangara goes too full outside off stump and Porterfield leans into a firm drive, the ball racing through the off side field for the first boundary of the morning
poor line to start with from Jongwe, slipping towards leg stump, and Stirling accepts the gift. He turns his bat over a leg-stump half volley to collect four runs to wide long on
and another! Much too full once again from Jongwe, but this time on the off side. Stirling steps right to the pitch and crunches a drive to the extra over boundary
Jongwe pulls his length back, but the line is still off. Stirling rides the bounce to nudge a single off his hip, the fielder at fine leg cleaning up as they are kept to one
very full indeed once again from Jongwe. It's hard to tell whether he's searching for swing or trying to york the batsman. Porterfield digs the ball out to the fielder at extra cover inside the ring
Porterfield pushes half forward to a length delivery and defends to extra cover
and this is left alone outside off, Jongwe eventually finding his radar in the over
good length from Panyangara, and just a hint of wobble through the air. It's enough to draw a cautious shot from Stirling as he defends into the covers.
a virtually identical ball. Not quite there to drive, but too full to pull. Stirling defends with the full face of the bat
a touch fuller this time. Stirling steps forward and drives just to the left of mid-off. The fielder gets around in time, but the batsmen steal a quick single
good lines from Panyangara. He's not trying to do too much, and he's been nicely accurate. Porterfield is forward in defence
this one hits the seam and leaves the left hander off the track. The line is wide enough for Porterfield to leave it alone without alarm
Panyangara restores some order for Zimbabwe with another dot ball, offering Porterfield nothing as he aims for the top of off stump. Good over, just one from it.
Jongwe charges in and angles the ball in to the right hander. The length is good, and Stirling defends from the crease
airy shot outside off! Stirling was perhaps undone by a little extra bounce outside off stump. He aimed to leather the ball through point, but swished past it. Mutumbami collects
fuller this time from Jongwe, and aimed right at the stumps. Stirling defends.
Got him! Or has he? Zimbabwe went up in unison as this length delivery passed Stirling's bat. Jongwe was rushing towards the keeper in celebration. But Umpire Cloete says no
a touch too straight from Jongwe, but Stirling's flick to leg is intercepted by the man at mid-on
full and wide outside off, but Stirling doesn't time his drive particularly well and the ball holds up on the outfield as the batsmen scamper back for the second
shaping in through the air towards off stump. Porterfield steps forward and bunts the ball back to the bowler.
Panyangara's exemplary lines continue. He's been swinging the ball in to the left hander, and seaming it away. This one does the latter, and Porterfield leaves it alone
Panyangara hits a length outside off stump, and again the ball seams away. Porterfield isn't interested in a shot
uppish! Porterfield was aiming to bisect the leg side field with this stroke, but the ball may just have held up a touch. There's a cry of "catch" but it falls well short of Chigumbura at mid on
Panyangara finds his metronome once more with a length delivery outside off, and Porterfield offers no stroke.
another leave from Porterfield, but this delivery was much closer to off stump! A good leave in the end  - though he's banked on good bounce
there's a grunt from the bowler as he lets this go, but the effort is in vain as the ball shoots down the leg side
a much better line, and the length isn't too bad either. Stirling plonks forward in defence
loose delivery, and that is spanked up and over extra cover off the back foot! Stirling holds nothing back in the shot. He leaned onto his back foot and thrashed the ball deliberately in the air
fuller from Jongwe, and there's a hint of leading edge as Stirling tries to turn it to leg. But the ball goes nowhere
sumptuous drive! Stirling looks in ominous form here, and he's been helped by Jongwe's scattergun approach. This is much too full and too wide, asking to be driven
the bowler pulls his length back, and he gives the batsman no width to work with. Defended off the back foot
Jongwe is all over the place here. He's not hit the same spot in the pitch twice. He offers up a gentle half volley and Stirling crunches the ball through the covers. No-one moved in the field

a little more effort from Porterfield, who's been watching Stirling's stunning strokeplay from the other end. He leans forward to drive, and the fielder rushes out to haul the ball in just before the ropes
Panyangara doesn't want to get driven by Stirling, and hits the pitch with a splice-jarring length. Stirling offers solid backfoot defence in response
a touch fuller this time, but not there for the drive. Stirling presses half forward and nudges watchfully to cover
nicely accurate from Panyangara. He hits a good length just about on off stump, and Stirling defends

oh dear, probably the first really bad ball Panyangara has bowled. It was shooting down the leg side, and touched Stirling's pad as he shaped to flick the ball. Mutumbami got half a glove on it behind the stumps, but he can't stop the leg byes.
much better from Zimbabwe's senior seamer. He seemed to bend his back a little more with this delivery, and Stirling defends to mid on
Chamu trundles in and hits a fullish length outside off. A good delivery to start with, and Porterfield defends to extra cover

Zimbabwe have not been anywhere close to their best in this first half hour. Now Sean Williams fumbles a simple fielding effort at fine leg to give the batsmen two where there should only have been one off Porterfield's glance
Chamu adjusts his line outside off stump, and the ball whizzes past Porterfield's outside edge.
genuine edge! But it drops short of Nyumbu at a wide first slip. The fielder does well to stop the ball as it died just in front of him
on a length on middle and off, and the left-hander leans forward to defend
the bowler strays onto Porterfield's pads with his final delivery, but Raza stops the shot cleanly at midwicket

soft dismissal! Panyangara floated down a gentle delivery, full on middle and leg, and Stirling couldn't keep his shot down. He seemed to almost pull out of the shot as he played it, and the ball travelled very gently indeed to Raza at midwicket. He holds a simple chance, and Zimbabwe have a much-needed breakthrough
Panyangara pushes the ball through very full and wide outside off. Too wide in fact
a good, diving effort from Raza at extra cover saves runs. Panyangara went very full again and Joyce was quickly into the drive, but Raza got a hand to the ball to take the sting out of his shot.
left well alone, the ball rising up outside off stump. This certainly looks a good pitch for batting. Pace and carry, value for shots
the line is a shade too close to leg stump, and Joyce flicks to fine leg
Panyangara's effort ball, this. It hits the seam and leaves Porterfield off the pitch. The left hander shoulders arms
good end to the over, the bowler aiming a length delivery at the top of off stump and the batsman firm in defence
cheeky single. Joyce angled the ball to the right of Wellington Masakadza at point, and the call from Porterfield is immediate
again Wellington Masakadza is in the action, but this time he rushes in very quickly from point to keep the ball to a dot
a similar line from the bowler - on off stump - but a touch fuller, and so Porterfield is forward in defence
watchful stuff from the Ireland captain. He has a good look at this delivery from Chamu is it rushes past him, his bat held high over his head

that is a fine catch! That's why Wellington Masakadza is at point then. Porterfield stepped back and aimed to cut Chibhabha away, but couldn't keep the shot down. The youngest Masakadza brother, who is left handed, tumbled to his right to hold onto the chance, which was firmly struck. Welcome to international cricket Wellington
Chigumbura opted to bring in another slip for the new batsman, but that meant there was a big gap at square leg and Balbirnie turns a length delivery exactly in that direction to get off the mark
Panyangara has a decent outswinger, and uses it well straight away to Balbirnie. The batsman leaves well alone
this one doesn't seem to go as much through the air, but it's wide enough of off stump that Balbirnie can safely leave it alone

the ball shaves the inside edge of the bat as Balbirnie tries to glance to leg, sending a shiver of excitement through the Zimbabweans. The ball trickles into space on the leg side and they snatch a run
yet another leave off Panyangara. He hits the deck hard and angles one across the left hander, who leaves alone
Joyce seemed to think about a drive to this one, but it wasn't quite there for the stroke and he plops a nothing shot in front of the mid off fielder
smartly done this time, Joyce tapping his bat down on a length delivery outside off to collect a single down to third man
full outside off, but Joyce aims for placement rather than power on the drive. But he can't get the ball through the gap and Waller stops it in the covers
outside off once again, but just back of a length. Joyce shoulders arms. There's been an awful lot of that from Ireland's left handers this morning
Joyce steps forward to drive and gets a decent enough connection, but aims his shot straight at Craig Ervine. Cleanly stopped
yet another leave outside off. The ball carries nicely through to Mutumbami, who is standing back
this is just wide enough to tempt a stroke from Joyce, but it's a safe one, and he runs the ball down to third man
just short of what you'd call a good length on this pitch, but Balbirnie is happy to defend
good length from the bowler first up, though the line is a little too close to leg stump. The shot is stopped by the midwicket fielder
full and straight again, Joyce drives but mistimes the shot and the bowler fields the ball in his follow through
angling across the left hander, who taps it down just wide enough of point to warrant a quick single
short and wide outside off stump. Balbirnie wants to cut, but he's not quite got the pace of the wicket yet, and mistimes the shot to extra cover
fuller this time from Jongwe, but wide once again. It's an inbetween length, so Balbirnie decides the best option is to leave it alone
a rising delivery strikes Balbirnie on the hip, and they rush through for a leg bye
Balbirnie's missed out here. The ball was a full toss around off stump, but he flicks it straight to Waller at midwicket
Balbirnie is deep in his crease as he steps back to push a length delivery to the bowler
uller on off stump from Chamu, and Balbirnie is right over the ball in defence. He's watching it very closely and playing the ball right under his eyes
another good length delivery is turned in defence to the leg side. Waller fields once again
Balbirnie leans into a good-looking on drive as Chamu floats one down a little too full. He struck it firmly, but straight to Jongwe at mid-on

is the ball just stopping on the batsmen a touch? Balbirnie stepped forward and aimed this drive into the covers, but he was too early on the shot and the ball went instead into the leg side. A tumbling Waller cuts it off

Joyce slashes hard at this rising delivery outside off, and top edges down to third man. There's a ripple of applause from the few spectators in the ground as once again Waller, down at third man now, stops the boundary
just short of a good length again from Jongwe, but Balbirnie's shot is not nearly as expansive as he runs the ball down to third man.
fuller and a little straighter to the left hander, who steps forward to push the ball back to the bowler
Joyce launches himself into a full-blooded cut, but he can't put bat to ball. Mutumbami collects the ball at head height - good carry off the young quick
a similar line, but fuller this time and Joyce pushes the ball straight to Wellington Masakadza at point
another rising delivery outside off stump, but a chastened Joyce decides not to offer any stroke to this one, leaving well alone
Balbirnie stands tall to force the ball off the back foot, but his shot goes finer than he would have liked and Williams, down at third man, keeps them to one
too straight from Chamu, and Joyce finds the gap between Raza and Chigumbura on the leg side to bring up Ireland's fifty with a brace
the bowler adjusts his line, and Joyce is a little late bringing his bat down on this ball outside off stump. He was aiming for third man. The ball bounces safely past the stumps
this time Joyce does find third man with an angled bat, and the batsmen trot through for a single

edged through the gully! This would have landed in third slip's lap. As it is, Nyumbu is the solitary slip fielder and it's well wide of him. Balbirnie was flat footed as he looked for the drive to a full delivery
careful defence from Joyce to end the over, the bowler keeping him honest with an accurate delivery on off stump
nicely accurate from Jongwe, and Balbirnie defends a length delivery into the covers
there's a squeal of excitement from the bowler as this very full delivery rushes past the batsman's leg glance and strikes the pad, but it was heading well down leg
outside off stump this time, and Balbirnie lets the ball through without a stroke
another leave from the right-hander to a ball that rises appreciably, but Jongwe has pushed this one too wide, and given away an extra
not the best day with the ball for Jongwe. He tries to re-adjust but pushes this one way down the leg side
a better delivery from the bowler, bouncing up at chest height on off stump. Balbirnie leaves it alone, and Chigumbura has a word with his bowler as he marches back to his mark
Jongwe is slowly finding his radar. This is a good, testing delivery on off stump, but it's met with classically high-elbowed defence

another catch for Wellington Masakadza! He seems to have a very safe pair of hands. Balbirnie leaned back to cut, and got a fierce connection on the ball, but couldn't keep the shot down. Masakadza tumbles to his right and holds the ball about a foot off the ground. He's enjoying his debut so far
full and straight to the left hander, who leans forward into a straight drive. But the timing is not quite there, and Chigumbura sprints across from mid on to cut it off
another full, straight delivery but again Joyce's shot is stopped in the field. This time it's Raza at midwicket
clean fielding from the Zimbabweans, who seem to be following their newest team-mate's example. Joyce drives into the covers but a diving Ervine tumbles to his right to stop the shot
Chamu pulls his length back a touch, and Joyce defends from the crease
again the length is a little on the short side, but this time Joyce sees the width he needs to cut. He beats point and gully, but Panyangara runs round the third man boundary to keep them to two.
a length delivery outside off is left alone to end the over
some turn and bounce, but it's in to Wilson's pads and he turns the ball through square leg for a single
the ball is definitely turning. Nyumbu fizzes this one from a middle and leg line past Joyce's defensive bat
big appeal! Nyumbu comes round the wicket and this one rushes on with the arm to strike Joyce on the pad. But the umpire is unmoved
top edged now! Extravagant bounce for Nyumbu and he finds the top edge of Joyce's cut. The ball evades the field and runs away for four to third man
fuller and straighter, and Joyce finds a gap on the leg side
Wilson gets right across to the off side to sweep, but the ball spins past him. In fact, it spins so much that Mutumbami can't take it cleanly, and they steal a bye
Wilson walks forward down the track to get at a full delivery from Chamu, but his mistimed drive goes straight to Chigumbura at mid off

cheeky single! Wilson drops the ball virtually at his feet, but the call from Joyce is immediate. Then it's a race between non-striker and bowler as Chamu sprints down the pitch at the ball. He gets there and kicks it, but past the stumps and Joyce is safe

monstrous strike! Chamu has no cover whatsoever out on the leg side, so when he slipped one down short on leg stump Joyce's eyes lit up. He pulled hard and didn't even try to keep it down, the ball striking the advertising boards beyond the boundary rope
much fuller from the bowler, and Joyce's soft shot goes straight to Raza at midwicket
Chamu aims rather closer to off stump with this delivery, and Joyce offers dead-bat defence
a good end to the over from the bowler, who once again zones in on a good length around off stump. Joyce defends, and Ervine rushes in from cover to stop any thoughts of a quick single
nice and straight from the bowler, and the ball is turned straight to midwicket
floated down a little too full by the offspinner, and Wilson collects an easy single to long on
Joyce cuts hard at a delivery that spins away from him outside off, but he's pinged the point fielder
this time Joyce rushes down the pitch to get to the spin. He doesn't quite get there, but pushes the ball into a gap on the leg side for a single
fiercely swept by Wilson! Nyumbu has protection out on the leg side, but Jongwe out at deep midwicket couldn't get close to this
quicker and flatter through the air from Nyumbu. Wilson presses forward in defence, and then looks for a single. But Raza is quickly in from midwicket.
Joyce flicks his first delivery towards midwicket, where Raza pulls off a diving stop
the batsman uses his feet now, getting right to the pitch and driving down to long on.
Wellington comes round the wicket to the right hander, who gets well forward to defend
a touch too full, and Wilson drives firmly to long off
turned with the spin into the leg side, but Raza is energetic as he swoops across to stop the shot
Raza can't get to this one, the ball rushing past him and down to long on as Joyce jumps down the wicket to drive
turn and bounce outside off stump, and it's enough to draw the timing out of Joyce's cut. But he finds a small gap between the cover and point fielders and they snatch a single
Wilson stretches forward to defend a full delivery outside off stump. Point rushes in to field
Wilson looks very convincing on the sweep. He gets low down to strike the ball firmly out to deep midwicket, but straight at the fielder
Joyce shimmies down the track at a flighted delivery, but doesn't trust the spin and defends.
nicely flighted again from Nyumbu. He gives it plenty of air and Joyce defends to point.
the left hander stretches well down the wicket, ending up on one knee as he smothers the spin in defence
Masakadza comes round the wicket to Wilson, who is forward and drives - but straight to Raza at cover
not quite as full from the young bowler this time, and Wilson's defence is hurried
nicely flighted from the bowler, and again Wilson can only defend. Masakadza looks a good prospect. High arm action
ah, just a little too wide this time and Wilson glides the ball down to third man. Williams is after it and pulls it up as they run three
Joyce flicks, but finds Raza at midwicket. He's had plenty of work to do in the field
driven hard, but straight back to the stooping bowler
Wilson flicks across the line, but the ball is stopped at midwicket
pushed into the leg side once again, but Wilson finds the fielder
again Wilson looks to go leg side, but he can't find the gap
chipped, but well short of Panyangara rushing in from long off
cut with the spin by Joyce, the ball rolling to point.
floated down full by the young bowler, and Joyce pushes the ball back to him
Joyce steps down the track, trying to upset the bowler's length, but his drive is stopped in the covers
no stopping this one! Joyce steps deep in his crease and forces firmly off the back foot, beating the diving cover fielder
someone shouts "catch!" as Joyce flicks to leg, but Williams at short fine can't get close to it
he's down the pitch again, and aims for wide long on. Raza dives at midwicket, but he can't stop the shot and they collect a single.
driven firmly once again, but this time it's straight at Raza and he fields cleanly
Joyce stays well back and aims to cut this one, but his shot goes straight to extra cover
lunging forward defence from the batsman as Nyumbu continues to come round the wicket
oyce gets well forward again, smothering the spin and defending to point
was this the arm ball from Nyumbu? It was definitely flatter through the air, but also a little too straight and Joyce finds a single to the left of short fine leg

that's a cracking stroke. Wilson doesn't try to over hit this one, just shuffles down the track to get to the pitch of it and chips up and over midwicket. He placed it perfectly, and collects a one bounce four
again Wilson is down the track, but this time Nyumbu spots him and pulls his length back. The only damage is a single to long on
edged! But that goes past Nyumbu at slip. He'd moved himself from first slip to a wide second, and Wilson edged exactly where he'd just been. That would have landed in his lap, but instead it's four
pushed out off the back foot through the covers, the sweeper cleans up
turned with the spin into the leg side
Wilson pushes forward and pings the gap at cover again, that's the fifty stand
turn and bounce! This would have gone straight to leg slip, if there was one. The fielder at short fine is after it, and stops the ball before the fine leg boundary
very full, and firmly driven but straight back to the bowler
nicely bowled by Nyumbu. Wilson is unsure whether to get forward or back as he defends
a little too short this time, Wilson gets well back in the crease and tucks an easy single through square leg
nicely stopped by Chigumbura, rushing around from extra cover as Joyce pushes off the back foot.
solid front foot defence from the left hander to a flighted delivery
Nyumbu continues round the wicket, and Joyce lets this one goes outside off stump, confident that it will spin away from him
a neat little glide from the batsman goes straight to Waller at backward point
Masakadza comes round the wicket to the right handed Wilson, who lunges forward in defence
Wilson stays back this time, but his backfoot press goes straight to Raza at extra cover
Wilson cuts as Masakadza pulls one down a touch too short, but he's aiming for placement rather than power
defended into the leg side
a single this time, the batsman finding a gap on the leg side

dropped by Waller at long on! This was a very simple chance. Joyce stepped down the pitch and aimed for a six, but couldn't get the connection he wanted. Waller set himself underneath it and seemed to have it covered ... Somehow the ball bobbled out. Costly miss for Zimbabwe
full and straight, pushed into the leg side
Williams aims at Joyce's pads, and the batsman nudges to midwicket.
same again from Williams, and the midwicket fielder is in action again

speared down the leg side, has Mutumbami missed a stumping now? The umpire calls wide, and Joyce is able to get safely back into the crease as the keeper fumbles. Actually, this looks a little more serious than a fumble. Mutumbami has been struck by the ball, and he's down
too short from Williams. Joyce leans back and punts one out to Waller on the boundary
driven firmly past the bowler for a single
very full and wide, and Joyce slices a drive out past point
nudged into the leg side this time, and he's found space for a single
pushed back to the bowler in defence
a little too short from Masakadza, and Wilson threads the gap at cover
pushed off the back foot, but straight to Chigumbura in the covers
deft little stroke from Joyce, cutting very late down on the ball to get two down to third man
arm ball from Williams, but it's too short and Wilson collects an easy single off his legs, the ball rolling out through square leg
turned with the spin to midwicket, but Raza is in very quickly to stop it
again Joyce flicks with the spin, but this time it's wide of Raza. Masakadza rushes out from square leg to keep them to one
pitched up on off stump, Wilson drives but his shot hits Raza at cover. Plenty of work for him in the field
very full once again, and Wilson leans forward to meet the ball with a firm sweep. Waller, at deep midwicket, fields cleanly
Joyce shuffles across to off and places the ball just wide of the fielder at short fine leg to pick up a single
Joyce steps forward and angles his bat to find a single in front of point. A quick call, and good running
much too short from the bowler, but Wilson's shot off his hips goes in the air and there's a cry of "catch it!" But the ball is wide of Chigumbura, who is close in on the leg side
driven firmly down to long off for one
again Nyumbu is too short to the right hander, and this time Wilson pulls the ball. The sweeper on the leg side keeps them to one
Zimbabwe are getting a little sloppy in the field. Joyce pushes off the back foot and Chigumbura looked to have this covered, but the ball bounces out of his hands and they take a single
driven with the spin down to long on, another single
Zimbabwe's spinners offering up a series of long hops to the right handed Wilson. He pulls Williams out to deep square, where there is a fielder to cut it off
short again from Williams, but Joyce's cut finds Waller at point
Joyce shuffles right across to the off side to change the angle, and two runs to fine leg brings up an important fifty
paddle-wept this time, and just the single
a slashed cut is intercepted at point
driven firmly back to the bowler, who fields it cleanly at his feet
Nyumbu continues after drinks, and Joyce nudges his first ball through the gap on the leg side for a single
Nyumbu comes round the wicket to Wilson, who gets well forward to play the ball under his eyes and collect a calm single to long on

well, where's this come from? Joyce was looking to open up against Nyumbu, and he cleared his front leg aiming for a slash through the off side. But he hit the ball neither high in the air or along the ground, and picked out Elton Chigumbura to perfection at extra cover. The Zimbabwe captain holds the catch, and an 83 run partnership is broken
calm defence from KOB to start
O'Brien stays deep in the crease and forces off the back foot, but straight to Raza in the covers
O'Brien leans his bulky frame forward and turns the ball with the spin into the leg side. Chigumbura at midwicket makes an easy stop

yet another short ball from Williams, and Wilson absolutely lashes a pull out to deep square, along the ground. The ball got to Raza in a flash, and he pulled off a good diving stop to save the boundary
that's a cute little shot, the batsman waiting on a shortish delivery outside off stump and running the ball past short third man
fuller and straigher from Williams, and the ball is defended back to him
speared in at the batsman's pads, and there's no space for a single
Williams offers up width and length outside off stump to invite an attacking stroke off the back foot. Ervine, the cover sweeper, sprints round the boundary to clean up
a better end to the over, full and straight and it's hit back to the bowler
spinning down the leg side, and that's called wide
better lines from Nyumbu, and Wilson's forward press is stopped by Raza charging in from cover point
nicely flighted, and this one bites off the pitch to take the inside half of Wilson's defensive bat
quicker through the air, and Wilson drives it back to the bowler
again Wilson is forward and driving, and though Nyumbu can't quite stop it cleanly they don't take a single
flicked with the spin into the leg side. Chigumbura dives at midwicket and gets a hand to the ball, but it gets away from him and they sprint through for one
driven hard out to wide long off, and Waller hurls the ball back in, having stopped it cleanly
speared down the leg side. O'Brien only has to help the ball on its way to collect four to long leg with a firm sweep
driven down to long on off the back foot, and that's Ireland's 150
another drive, this time off the front foot and to long off
Williams is having a shocker with the ball. His length has been all wrong. This is very short again, and it's heaved away to wide long on for four
left alone outside off stump, Williams having come around the wicket
a typically powerful drive from O'Brien bursts through the hands of the cover fielder, and they're back for the second
Wilson turns this into the leg side with the spin, but he finds Chigumbura at midwicket
Wilson stays back in his crease to cut, but Williams at backward point dives to keep them to one

Waller holds a catch! He would have been under some pressure as this ball rocketed towards him. Kevin O'Brien had jumped down the crease at Nyumbu, who came round the wicket, but the bat turned in his hands as he aimed down the ground. He still got a decent enough connection, but not enough to get the ball past Waller, who set himself under the chance at long off and managed to hold on. That'll be a relief for him.
turned with the spin into the leg side. The batsmen crossed while the ball was in the air, so Thompson's yet to see the strike
Nyumbu comes around the wicket and aims for Wilson's legs, and the ball is clipped to the square leg fielder inside the circle
turned into the leg side again, and this time he finds Chigumbura at midwicke
full and on Thompson's toes, but the field is set close now and he pings the leg side fielder
not quite as full, and Thompson is half forward in defence
again Thompson is forward, but this time he sets himself for a glance. But can't beat the field
Mutumbami shouts "catch" as Thompson drives in the air down the ground. The ball went far to Williams' left though, no real chance
pitched right up to the batsman, who drives to long off for a single

that looks very plumb indeed, and Williams' lbw appeal is quickly upheld. This was quicker and flatter in the air, and it looked as though Thompson couldn't get his bat down quickly enough. Zimbabwe have another, and they're right back into this now
good start from Masakadza as he comes back into the attack, zipping one down on a length to draw a defensive stroke from the batsman
just short! Wilson looked to drive this time, and didn't keep the stroke down. The ball rocketed towards Raza at extra cover, but died just in front of him
more watchful defence this time, the ball trickling to point
just a shade too full from Masakadza, and Wilson glances past a diving Chigumbura at midwicket. Long on clean up
quicker one from Wellington, and Mooney's defence is hurried
there's half an appeal from the bowler, though I'm not sure for what. Lbw perhaps, with Mooney defending. At any rate, it's not given
big drive from Wilson, but the ball shoots under his bat and ricochets off Mutumbami's pads, rolling to fine leg. Byes given
speared down the leg side, a clear wide
not much flight again for Williams, and Mooney cuts past point for one
short and wide outside off, but Wilson's cut is stopped by Ervine at deep cover
Mooney sweeps hard, and again Ervine has some work to do in the deep. Just the one
nudged through point off the back foot again, just the one

miscommunication between the batsmen, but they don't pay the price! Mooney had fetched a ball from outside off down to long on, and Panyangara fumbled on the boundary. Wilson wanted a second, Mooney wasn't sure, but the throw went wide.
a scything drive goes out to deep cover
reverse sweep from Mooney, and an expansive one, but he swishes past the ball and is struck on the pad
rather more orthodox stroke this time, Mooney threading a gap on the leg side to collect a single
driven hard, but straight at the cover fielder
this time he finds the gap, but there's a sweeper on the cover boundary so it's just one

a maiden international wicket for Wellington Masakadza! And it took a good catch out in the deep to complete it. Mooney bent low down and then aimed a slog sweep at the Tobacco Stand on the Western side of the ground, but got rather more height than distance. Jongwe was the fielder out there, and he initially ran in before backpedalling a couple of steps and setting himself for the catch. He held on cleanly, and Wellington bent down on one knee midpitch in celebration
Wilson thinks about jumping down the pitch, but he can't get close enough to the ball and defends back to the bowler
well, after that superb catch Jongwe has run straight past a ball hit along the ground to him at long on. They're back for the second after Wilson's drive
and that will be Wilson's fifty, the batsman shimmying down the track and driving along the ground to long off
precious little flight from Williams, and Dockrell stays deep in his crease to defend to point.
fuller this time, and Dockrell creams a drive to long off
hurled at the batsman's toes, Wilson flicks but it's straight to the man at short fine leg
Dockrell lunges forward, but his drive goes straight to Raza at extra cover

another for Wellington! Dockrell jumped down the track but swung past a delivery that gripped and turned past his outside edge. There was no mistake from Mutumbami with the gloves, and he's cleanly stumped. Ireland are fading somewhat now after their good start
the left handed McBrine gets forward and drives with the spin to get off the mark with a drive to long on
slanting in towards the pads of Wilson, and he collects a couple through square leg
width offered outside off, and Wilson carves a drives out to deep cover
tip and run cricket from McBrine. He drops the ball down close on the leg side, but there's enough space around it for Wilson to call for a sharp single
full and straight, and McBrine's bottom hand sends the ball to Chigumbura at a straight midwicket
again Chigumbura is in action, bending low to stop another flick from McBrine
for the third ball in the row Chigumbura is the only fielder Zimbabwe need, again intercepting McBrine's nudge to leg
well what's this, a reverse sweep from the tailender. But he can't lay bat to ball and the delivery fizzes past him
a touch too short from Williams, and McBrine muscles the ball out to deep square
Wilson flicks one off his toes, just wide of short fine leg, to keep the strike

that's really good running from Ireland. There are three men out on the leg side, which is where Wilson struck the ball, but he didn't hit it very hard and as the fielders rushed in he called for the second run
Wilson jumps down the track, but telegraphs his move and Masakadza spots him coming. He draws his length well back and Wilson must defend
nice little chip up and over the off side field now. Waller rushes around from long off to keep them to two
creamed down the ground, but along the ground and long on is able to get around quickly enough to stop the boundary
punched back firmly at the bowler
smart cricket from Wilson. He makes a lot of room and angles the ball to Williams' right at point to steal a single and keep the strike
length from Panyangara to start with, and angling in towards Wilson's pads. He shovels a shot into the leg side and they sprint through for one

no holding back from McBrine as he steps down the track at the bowler, but Panyangara spots him coming and pulls the ball down short. An airy shot is spooned out to deep extra cover and they take a single.
another short ball from Panyangara, and it looked like the slower bouncer. Wilson swivels and pulls, square leg keeps them to one.

there's a fancy shot from McBrine! Panyangara continues with the short ball approach, but this is the quicker one. McBrine stands at the crease and ramps the ball cleanly up and over Mutumbami for four.
on a length and straight. McBrine nudges the ball to leg and Panyangara himself hares after it. They rush back for the second.
McBrine has all sorts of shots! How he unfurls a paddle scoop to an attempted yorker, striking the ball well enough to beat the man at short fine leg and collect a boundary.
he's full and straight to start with, and Wilson clips the ball of his toes out to deep square. They rush back for the second
great delivery, a quick yorker, but Wilson is equal to it and digs it out to mid-off. McBrine calls straight away and they snatch a single.

towering shot! McBrine is playing a gem of a cameo here to lift his side. Jongwe hurled down a length delivery and McBrine was cleanly underneath it. For a moment Raza at long-on thought he might be in with a chance for a catch, but the ball sailed right over him.

McBrine shuffles across to off but Jongwe follows him with a full straight one. The ball is shovelled down the ground, and a tag team effort from the fielders at long-off and long-on keep them to two.
very full again, and McBrine can only dig it out for one into the covers.
edged up and over short third man, and Wilson ends the innings with a boundary. Third man was up, so the shot was on.

inn2.comm: Mooney's first delivery is full on off stump, and is harmlessly driven to O'Brien at mid off
huge, emotive appeal for lbw! But the umpire is unmoved, and as the ball rolls down to third man the batsmen take a single. That looked too high. Leg byes given
Mutumbami walks down the pitch to the first delivery he's faced, but Mooney's length is a little short and he defends back down the track off the back foot
flowing drive from the batsman as Mooney pitches it up once more, but he's picked out O'Brien at mid off again. There doesn't seem to be much swing for Mooney
there is, however, a touch of seam movement. He bangs this one hard into the pitch and it cuts back in to the batsman, beating a flat-footed poke. Plenty of encouragement from behind the stumps
good delivery to end the over, on a length and just outside off stump. Mutumbami stands at the crease to defend towards cover point
Murtagh releases a back-of-a-length delivery off an energetic run, and Chibhabha stands tall to defend into the leg side

a powerful stroke off the legs brings four to deep midwicket. Murtagh was too full and too straight with this one, and with no-one out in the deep Chamu didn't bother to keep his flick down. A couple of bounces and it's over the rope
a better line from Murtagh, and Chamu angles the bat face to thread the gap at cover point. It's not the most convincing stroke, but it brings a single
on a length and wobbling away from the bat just outside off stump. Mutumbami shoulders arms
Murtagh beats the outside edge of a noncommittal poke outside off stump. Mutumbami thrust his bat out at one that left him off the track, and didn't get close
the batsman can't be convinced to attempt a stroke at the final delivery of the over, which is on a length and wide outside off stump
short outside off stump, and Chamu swivels onto the back foot to pull. But the ball doesn't get up much, scooting underneath his attempted shot
this one has definitely hit the seam. Mooney has been bringing the ball back in to the right-hander off the pitch, but this one holds its line outside off. Chamu withdraws his bat in time.

ooh, that's almost popped up to that catcher at short extra. Mooney pitched this one right up and Chamu was looking for the drive, but hit it uppishly. It bounced a couple of metres in front of the fielder.

hooked in the air now! Chamu goes back and across to a Mooney bouncer and doesn't keep his shot down, but fortunately for him he didn't get a lot on it. The fine leg fielder ran in, but it fell well in front of him.
edged! But short. This is a slightly nervy start by Zimbabwe. This delivery again seemed to hold its line outside off as Chamu pushed at it, but the edge fell well short of slip.
that's a better shot. Pitched up outside off and Chamu throws himself into a full blooded drive. Through the covers for four
Murtagh sprints to the crease and hits a splice-jarring length outside off. Defended off the back foot.
this almost sneaked through! Much fuller from Murtagh, almost a yorker, but the bat is jammed down in time and the ball trickles into space on the leg side.
hurled down the leg side now, and this would have been called wide had it not flicked the pad.
past the outside edge! Mutumbami isn't sure whether to go forward or back, and eventually does neither.
short of a good length, and a touch too straight as well. Mutumbami is untroubled this time, working the ball off his hip for a single.
Chamu stretches well forward in defense as Murtagh ends the over with a pitched up delivery aimed at the stumps
short and powerfully pulled! A confident stroke from the batsman, and he's got acres of space to aim for out in the deep on the leg side.

gone this time! This one was much fuller from Mooney, and also possibly slower through the air. Mutumbami set himself to whip it through the leg side, but he was much too early on the stroke. Mid-on circles back to hold an easy chance.
Ervine presents the full bat face to a length delivery on off stump, riding a little extra bounce.
Mooney pushes this one a little further outside off stump but on a similar length. Ervine doesn't need to play a stroke, and lets the ball pass him.
the left-hander is off the mark with a firm push through cover point, off the back foot. He did enough to pick the gap, but the ball is hauled in well short of the boundary.
there's a stifled appeal as ball strikes pad. Ervine missed with his flick to leg, but this pitched well outside leg stump.
angled in to the stumps on a testing length. Chamu presses forward and the ball strikes the inside half of his defensive bat

that's a more confident stroke. Again the ball was full and angled in, but this time Chamu's bottom-handed flick sent it bouncing out to deep midwicket. The fielder at long leg bounds around as the batsmen run three.
a touch of extra bounce here? Murtagh bent his back on this delivery and it leapt off a length, Ervine taking his bottom hand off the bat as he thrusts forward defensively.
a neat little push and run brings one. Ervine steps forward to meet the ball and nudges it just wide of mid-off.

well, I don't think that's where he wanted to hit it, but Chamu collects a boundary to long-on. He'd set himself for a blast through the covers, but the ball held up on him and the shot went on the opposite side of the wicket, beating a diving mid-on.
full and wide outside off, and Chamu opts to leave it alone.
Ervine plays this length delivery nice and late, right under the eyes. Though the connection is good, it goes to point on the bounce and there's no run to be had.
another forthright stroke is intercepted on the off side. This one was played straighter, and it's the fielder at extra cover who stops it.
action replay. Another good connection from Ervine, but he's picked out extra cover perfectly.
now he finds the gap. This was the shortest ball of the over so far, but it was also wide of off stump. Ervine got up on his toes and punched firmly off the back foot, beating point's left hand.
Mooney adjusts his line and length, and Ervine steps forward to drive a full, straight one to O'Brien at mid-on
ah, the slower ball from Mooney! He looped it down very full, but it's spotted early by the batsman and dug out to Joyce at extra cover.
on a length and coming in to the right-hander off the pitch. Chamu gets across and half forward in defense.
past the outside edge! Much fuller, and wider too, but the batsman's extravagant drive hits fresh air.
Chamu plays from the crease and turns the ball softly into the leg side.
a tempting length outside off, but Chamu doesn't take the bait. Left well alone.
neatly whipped off the legs, and as the fielders converge on the ball in the deep the batsmen turn for a second. Hard running.
too straight again from Murtagh, but the batsman's connection isn't quite as clean this time and they can only manage a single in front of square on the leg side

what's that hit? It must have been the bat as it's given as runs. McBrine's first ball is short and headed down the leg side. Chamu helps it on its way, getting the ball very fine between the keeper and leg slip.

almost caught in the deep! Again McBrine was short, and Chamu aimed to put this one into the stands beyond midwicket. But he didn't time it all that well, and in fact that's what saved him as the fielder running in from that position couldn't quite get to it.
looped down full and just outside off. Ervine calmly steps forward and collects a single through the covers.
speared down the leg side, and the ball kisses the pad on the way down. Good running brings three leg byes
Ervine stretches well forward and angles his drive to send the ball out to the man at deep cover.

he's burgled a wicket! This was much too short again, and Chamu might have put it anywhere on the leg side. But he's picked out Murtagh at short fine leg! The fielder had to bend quite low to hold the catch, but it was straight to him. Chamu had looked untroubled, but he's got to go.
imperiously driven down the ground by Ervine. A languid stroke to a pitched up delivery, but it's pinged right out of the middle.
Murtagh pulls his length back a shade, and Ervine leans forward at the crease to defend to cover point.
a very similar delivery is treated in an identical fashion. Ervine props forward and defends.

through the covers this time! Ervine never looks to be in a hurry, but when he times the ball he's hard to contain. This was too full and too wide, but he still had to hit it well to beat the man at extra cover. And that brings up Zimbabwe's fifty
a good readjustment from Murtagh as he lands a length delivery on middle end leg. Nudged gently to midwicket
and a quiet end to the over, Ervine defending another length delivery back down the pitch to the bowler.
he comes round the wicket and lands a ball just outside off. Quietly defended to cover.
the umpire ducks for cover! This was a similar delivery but Williams met it with a swipe of the bat, putting Umpire Russell Tiffin in danger. Four runs, down the ground.
full, and driven to Mooney at long-off for a single.
Ervine follows suit, stretching forward to collect a single down the ground.
a touch short and spinning away from the left-hander. Williams leans back and cracks a shot out to the cover sweeper
spinning away outside off, and Ervine cuts out to deep cover. Some tardy fielding allows them back for the second.
tossed down full and straight, Williams defends back down the pitch.
a little straighter this time, but Williams' nudge to leg is stopped by the midwicket fielder.
a similar ball and a similar stroke, though this time Stirling himself runs around to cut it off
Williams waits in the crease for the ball to turn, and then beats point on the cut. There is, however, a sweeper out at deep cover.
pitched up on the legs, and Ervine pushes one down to long-on.
Williams waits in the crease again, but his backfoot punch goes straight to extra cover.
chipped down the ground, and as Mooney sprints round from wide long-off they come back for the second.
gently defended back down the ground to the bowler.
reverse sweep now, to a very full ball, and the man at backward point manages to get a palm on it to take the sting out of the shot.
Williams stretches forward and drills the ball down to long-off. Zimbabwe are rotating the strike quite easily.
a little more flight on this one, and it's nicely straight too. Williams opts for caution and defends.
and the quicker one to end the over. Dug out back to the bowler.
Stirling comes round the wicket and spears a quick delivery at Ervine's pads. The left-hander flicks out to deep square.
pushed gently to the man at midwicket
this delivery is a touch fuller, and Ervine finds a single to long-on.
thumped down to long-off by Williams. He saves his legs and walks the single.
Ervine stretches his long legs forward to defend.
good placement from the batsman. He glanced to leg, in front of square, but got the ball right between the men at long-on and deep midwicket, allowing two runs.
he starts with a shortish delivery on off stump, which Williams thumps straight to extra cover.
a touch short once more, but Williams steps back to push it straight back to the bowler
lobbed down outside off, and Williams keeps a very close eye on the ball as he lets it go past him
pushed out to deep cover off the back foot. Just the one
nicely placed by Ervine, poking the ball between backward point and cover for another single

Williams ends the over with a reverse-sweep, but doesn't quite get it where he wants it. The man at backward point went the wrong way when he saw the shot Williams was attempting, but the cover sweeper runs in to keep them to a single.
dropped at slip! That's a let-off for Ervine. He pressed forward to defend but couldn't quite get to the pitch. Joyce leapt to his right at slip and got a hand to it, but couldn't hold on.
ouch, and now Williams rubs it in by jumping down the pitch to thump the ball in the air to wide long-on.
defended back down the track.
the bowler offers room outside off and the batsman threads a single through cover.
Ervine flicks to leg, but the ball goes nowhere and Wilson leaves his station behind the stumps to stop any thought of a single.
cut out in front of square on the off side, and there's cover in the deep.
appreciable bounce for the tall Dockrell, but not a great deal of turn. Ervine flicks through square leg.
and now Williams collects a single in the same direction. Whipped off the pads.
Ervine drives at a full one, but slices at the ball and it goes to Stirling at backward point, along the ground.
very full and landing on a middle and leg line. Driven to long-on.
Williams looks for the nudge through square leg but the fielder is much straighter now and cuts it off
and a push back to the bowler ends the over
a shade too short to start with, and Ervine punches the ball to deep cover for one.
Williams stretches forward to drive to long-on
Stirling is very annoyed at himself as he drops the ball short again. But the toll isn't too heavy - just a single to long-off.
Williams makes a little room and slugs a drive out to wide long-off. The fielder has some work to do, and they've time to get back for the second.
Williams leans back to pull this one, but it rushes on to him and he can't connect properly. Easily stopped at midwicket
nudged back down the pitch to the bowler.
sharp fielding by Dockrell off his own bowling, rushing across to stop a shot back down the ground.
chopped to backward point off the back foot
Ervine plays around his front pad as he looks for the gap on the leg side, but he finds square leg.
again Ervine looks to play the ball into the leg side, but this time to midwicket
pushed firmly off the back foot, and the deep cover fielder trots in to keep them to one
Williams comes forward to push the ball softly into the leg side.
Stirling twirls down an offspinner on a good length, and Ervine offers a defensive bat in response.
this one is hurled down a little quicker, and it's picked off his legs for one.
Williams brings up the fifty stand with a top-edged sweep! He was looking to go fine but the ball bounced on him, ballooning well over Wilson's head.
full and straight, and Ervine pushes it back to the bowler.
good awareness from the batsmen. Ervine's defensive push went into the space between point and cover, and Williams called immediately for the single.
very full, and it's dug out back to the bowler.
Ervine chops down very late on this delivery, which was aimed at off stump, and the ball rolls to point.
a paddle sweep rolls down to fine leg, the batsmen take an easy single.

stumped! He's got him, and the partnership is broken. Dockrell hasn't been turning the ball, and it's the lack of turn that has done him in. The ball was flighted outside off, and Williams stretched forward to drive. But the ball rushed straight on past him, and Wilson had the bails off in a flash. Ireland have an opening here.
an iffy start for the Zimbabwe captain. He stays at the crease and exposes his stumps as the ball rushes on to him.
flat-footed once more from Chigumbura, and the ball takes the splice of the bat before rolling to gully.
now he's well forward, but he plays outside the line of the delivery and is struck on the pad. There's a yelp of excitement from Ireland, but he's well outside the line.
Ervine nudges one off his pads and Chigumbura calls them through for a quick single.
Chigumbura shimmies down the track to get to the pitch, pushing the ball back to the bowler.
Chigumbura is forward in defence now, presenting the full face of the bat
a little shorter from McBrine, and Chigumbura flicks to leg but the midwicket fielder is quickly around to cut the ball off.
nicely bowled, landing outside off stump and spinning in. Chigumbura defends.
this one lands on middle and spins to leg, but Chigumbura's glance goes straight to the square leg fielder.
looped down outside off stump. Ervine leans right across to cover his stumps and lets it go.
fuller this time, and Ervine angles a defensive push to backward point.
flicked off the toes, and straight to midwicket.
again Dockrell is full and straight, and Ervine's drive goes down to long-on
good use of the feet by Chigumbura. He skips out and drives to long-off for one
too short outside off stump, but Dockrell has cover in the deep and a well-timed cut only brings a single.
speared down flat and fast, but the ball still grips and Ervine needs a hurried defensive push to keep it out.
flighted this time, and the ball is eased down to long-off
after that nervous start Chigumbura is starting to move nicely to the spinners. Again he uses his feet to get to the pitch and drives firmly to long-off.
Ervine goes back and across to this one, pushing off the back foot for a single to long-on.
turning in to the pads, but Chigumbura's wristy flick is turned to square leg
driven to long-on for one.
edged! But it flies very fast past a diving slip fielder and runs away for four. Chigumbura pushed very hard at the delivery.
a booming sweep is top edged! This time the ball flies up and over both the slip and the keeper, and they rush back for the second.
nervous stroke! Chigumbura wants to nudge it to leg but the ball stops on him, fortunately landing short of the midwicket fielder
a bad ball releases some pressure. Short and wide outside off, and Chigumbura gets off strike with a single.
Dockrell goes full to the left-hander, who drives down the ground for one.
Chigumbura stays leg side of this one, driving hard back down the ground to beat a diving Dockrell and collect a single.
ah, that's a handsome drive from Zimbabwe's captain. He's right to the pitch of it, and beats Stirling at cover. Long-off runs round to keep them to two
nudged off the hip, Chigumbura pings the square leg fielder.
Chigumbura is down the track to drive to long-off.
there's a hint of a leading edge to Ervine's defensive push to leg, but the ball falls well short of the cover fielder.
angled to backward point.
nicely played. McBrine arrowed the ball down at Ervine's pads and the batsman got right across to flick the ball very fine. Four runs
Dockrell comes round the wicket to Chigumbura, who props half forward to defend to leg.

edged, and gone! Well, he edged a couple in the last over, and now one has landed in Wilson's gloves. The ball looked an innocuous one, wide outside off stump, but Chigumbura cut underneath it and Wilson held a sharp chance. Zimbabwe's target is only 96 runs away, but Ireland are keeping themselves in the hunt.
Raza stretches forward to defend his first ball to extra cover.
accurate stuff from Dockrell, and again Raza can only defend.
watchful stuff from Zimbabwe's no. 6, another defensive push.
and he's off the mark with the final delivery of the over, driving down to long-off.
O'Brien's first delivery is a loosener outside off, but it's cracked straight to the extra cover fielder.
straighter this time, and Raza stands at the crease to defend to leg.
this looked like an offcutter from O'Brien. It kissed the track and came back in at Raza, who bent forward to defend.
quick single! Raza nudged the ball to mid-off and hared off immediately. He was safely home, though the throw was a good one and dislodged a bail.
fifty for Ervine! A vital knock for his team. He gets to the mark with a neat flick down to long leg, where there is a fielder placed.
crunched off the back foot by Raza. A strong shot, but there's a man at deep cover to stop it.
almost a false stroke from Raza. It was short outside off but he didn't seem sure about the amount of turn or bounce. Chopped down to extra cover.
fuller this time, and it's pushed defensively into the covers.
ah, now this is too full and Raza is easily able to drive to long-off.
pushed softly back down the track.
a touch too short outside off, and Ervine collects a single with a cut to deep cover
Raza gets solidly behind a defensive push to end the over
full and a little too straight, allowing Ervine easy access to a single through square leg.
Raza stands tall to force the ball off the back foot, but he can't beat the field.
a leading edge! Raza wanted to whip this to leg, but it stopped on him and went in to opposite direction. Point was interested, but it fell well short.
Raza sends a length delivery back to the bowler with a bottom-handed push.
an offcutter is nudged to mid-on, the ball rolling slowly to the fielder.
cries of "catch!" go up as Raza cuts this in the air, but it falls a metre or so in front of point and bounces through his hands.
too short from Stirling to start with, and Raza is able to force the ball away off the back foot through extra cover.
all the while, it's been calm stuff from Ervine. He waits on an offspinner and pushes it down the ground for one.
Raza looks to manufacture a stroke by backing away to leg, but the offspin follows him and the shot goes to backward point.
Raza aims squarer this time, threading the gap at cover point for one out into the deep.
Ervine stays back to push the ball to midwicket.
a flighted, loopy delivery is met with a lunge down the wicket and a solid forward defensive.
edged, and four! Wilson probably wouldn't have been able to reach this, even if he'd been standing back. Raza flashed at a length delivery outside off, and the ball beat third man running round.
a more authoritative stroke this time, the right-hander staying back and thrashing a cut out to deep point.
yet another forcing stroke off the back foot, but this one rolls out straight towards the cover sweeper so it's just a single.
a bottom edged cut goes through Wilson's legs and down to third man, and the batsmen rush back for two.
O'Brien comes around the wicket to the left-handed Ervine, who presses forward to defend.
a brave shot from Ervine, using the pace on a quicker one from O'Brien. He gets very low, right down on one knee, and laps a full ball down to the fine leg boundary.
Stirling drags one down short, and Raza is in no trouble as he leans back and forces the ball out into the deep on the off side.
fuller this time, and flighted too. Ervine is watchful in defence.
the 150 comes up for Zimbabwe via a leg bye, a full ball brushing Ervine's pad and rolling to short fine leg.
pushed defensively to extra cover off the front foot.
again Raza presents a defensive bat, pushing the ball back to the bowler.
flat and fast from Stirling, and Raza cracks the ball straight at the extra cover fielder inside the ring.
a flighted offspinner, delivered from around the wicket, is driven to long-off for one.
this one dips, grips and turns in to Raza, who defends back down the track.
the batsman uses his feet now, but he can't get to the pitch of it and must defend.
a little too full now, a half volley really, and Raza is released with a drive to long-off

what's happened here? Ireland went up in unison as the ball passed Ervine's bat. Wilson also whipped the bails off, but it wasn't the square leg umpire who gave him out. Yep, that's caught behind, and it's a huge dismissal for Ireland.
Waller meets his first delivery with a full stride down the pitch and a perpendicular defensive bat.
Raza takes a couple of steps down the track, but turns the delivery into a yorker and has to dig it out.
firmly driven through extra cover. The fielder there tumbled over the ball, but got half a hand to it.
speared down flat and fast by Stirling. Waller defends to cover point.
another defensive poke from Waller. He's just tapped the ball but he then charges down the track looking for a single that wasn't there. I'd wager he's a little nervous right now.
Waller goes back and across to defend back down the track.
this a little straighter from Stirling, and the offspin sends it further towards the leg side, but Waller's flick finds square leg.
Raza allows the ball to come on to him and then shovels to leg with the spin, finding a slight gap between square leg and midwicket for a single.
Waller presses forward again, nudging the ball in front of point. He's very eager for this single, but it's not coming just yet.
flicked off the pads this time, but again he finds the field.
gosh, well he's off the mark but this is nervous stuff. Waller wanted the single, then he didn't but eventually both batsmen committed and the shy at the stumps went wide.
that'll calm Zimbabwe down a little bit. Raza spots width outside off and jumps down the track to launch an inside-out drive over cover. Strong shot.
again Raza is down the pitch, but this time he keeps his drive along the ground and gets one to long-off.
his first delivery back bites into the pitch and holds its line outside off to beat Raza's edge.
a similar line and length just outside off, but this time Raza gets over the top of it and runs a single down to third man.
on a fullish length and angling in. Waller gets forward and defends right under his eyes.
nicely full again, and a little straighter from Murtagh. Waller defends it back to the bowler.
Murtagh is hitting a good length now, with the batsman unwilling to play any expansive shots just yet - and with a ring of fielders in the covers. Waller steps half forward and pushes to extra cover.

he's gone! A scratchy innings comes to an end. There was only one fielder left out in the deep, and Waller has picked him out to perfection. Murtagh dug the ball in, and the batsman stepped back to pull in the air ... and Thompson didn't have to move at deep midwicket.
Raza steps forward to a Stirling offspinner, and threads the gap at cover point for a single.
Jongwe steps confidently down the track to drive down the ground. Stirling bends down but he can't quite stop the shot
flicked off the pads, but straight to the man at midwicket.
short and wide outside off, Raza leans back in the crease and slaps a cut out to the cover sweeper.
firm defence from Jongwe, the batsman stretching well down the pitch.
muscled down the ground by Jongwe, the ball whizzing past a ducking Raza. They rush back for the second as long-on sends the ball back in.
Raza forces off the back foot and the ball flies in the air through the vacant gully region and down to third man.
this kicks off a length to hit the splice of Jongwe's bat, the batsman taking his bottom hand off the bat handle.
nicely played by Jongwe, getting over the top of a length delivery and angling it down to third man.
was this the offcutter? It seemed to jag back in, but Raza's hurried defensive push finds a gap at cover point and they take a single.
Jongwe leans his tall frame forward to defend a full delivery to extra cover
a very similar ball is met with an identical defensive shot.
drilled out to deep cover, and they take the single.
nudged off the toes, but straight to the man at midwicket.
Jongwe skips down the to drive to long-off.

oh dear, what's happened here? Raza whipped an offspinner off his pads but it went very close to the square leg fielder. Jongwe called for the run, but Raza sent him back. Jongwe was already halfway down the pitch by that stage, and Joyce's throw caught him well short.
ooh, this has kept quite low and Raza had to jam the bat down on it very quickly. But he collects a single to long-on for his troubles.
Wellington negotiates his first delivery in international cricket well enough, bending forward to defend.
nervous stuff. Raza pops the ball in the air, but well short of the mid-on fielder. He wants a single, and calls straight away, but he really has to motor to get home.
on a length just outside off. Masakadza jams his bat down to get a single to third man.
pulled well in front of square! The ball wasn't all that short, but Raza was back and waiting for it. With mid-on up, he only had one fielder to beat, and did so with a cracking shot.
flicked off the pads for another single
Murtagh aims this one right at Masakadza's stumps, but he's right behind it in defence.

well played all-round by Masakadza. He threaded the gap at midwicket with a confident flick, and then put the fielder under pressure by quickly calling for the second. The throw at the stumps came in wide, though he'd have been safely home anyway.
too short from Stirling, and Raza steps back to crunch a shot to wide long-off. Just the single though.
Joyce has his hands in the air at slip! This was pushed through flat and fast, and the ball beat Wellington's flashing cut. No edge
nudged into the leg side, and there's no chance of a single.
Stirling tosses this one up, and Wellington stays back to defend.
finally the single comes, the left-hander glancing out into the deep on the leg side.
Stirling keeps Raza quiet with a fast delivery speared in at the stumps, eliciting a watchful forward defensive.
Wellington slugs across the line and gets the ball down to long-on for a single.
turn and bounce for Dockrell! The ball grips and spins past Raza's outside edge.
now this one rushes on with the arm, but Raza is well forward in defense.
Raza comes down the track, but Dockrell spots him coming and pulls his length back.
flat and fast, and aimed right at off stump. Pushed back to the bowler
fuller outside off stump, and Raza somehow finds a single through the cover field.

that's gone from a very cheeky single to a well-run three. Raza nudged the ball down close on the leg side, and though Wellington was safely in Joyce hurled the ball very hard at Wilson, from close in. It burst through his gloves and they collected two more.
more sharp running from Zimbabwe. Wellington flicks to leg but the ball goes nowhere. But Raza is alert, and calls him through straight away.
short, and pulled hard out to deep midwicket! But the ball plugs in the outfield, and they can only manage two.
Raza stays deep in his crease and forces the ball down to long-off. A single taken.
looped down on off stump. Wellington is solidly forward to defend.
even slower through the air now, but Wellington keeps his eye on the ball and stretches right over it to defend.
Raza rushes out of his crease, but he was in danger of running past this ball outside off stump. But he gets bat to ball and defends.
this wasn't all that short, but Raza stepped right back and drilled a pull down to long-on.
plopped down very close as Wellington defends on the off side. Both batsman perked up at the thought of a cheeky single, but it wasn't on.

dropped! This was very full on off stump, and Wellington wanted to drive down the ground. He drove it in the air, low but catchable. Dockrell got a hand to it in his follow-through but couldn't cling on. How important will that prove?
sliced away to point off the back foot. No run.
and Raza sees Dockrell's final delivery off with a defensive nudge to midwicket.
his first ball is very full indeed, though not quite the yorker. Wellington digs it out to mid-off.
on the pads, and it's neatly glanced down to fine leg.
down the ground! Mooney charged in and bowled a full toss. Raza cleared his front leg and powered the ball down the ground.

fifty up for Raza, and it's warmly greeted by the animated crowd that's come in this afternoon. It was another tap and run single, this time in front of point. Plenty of cheering down at Castle Corner.
Mooney bends his back as he attempts a bouncer, but it shoots down the leg side. A clear wide.
superb running from the batsmen! Wellington flicked to leg and the fielder at fine leg charged in, but the call for two came very quickly, and they made it with a second or two to spare.
Mooney ends the over with a legitimate bouncer, the left-hander ducking underneath it.

nicely played by Raza. The ball was full and wide, yorker length really, but he jammed the bat down on it to get the ball through point. Raza always wanted the second run, and returns to his crease as the throw came in.
is that another drop? It looked like it! A really tough chance for Wilson behind the stumps. It was another full ball, but this time the shot came off the face of the bat and flew past the keeper.

drama! Is there another twist in this tale? Raza lofted a length delivery out to deep cover, where it fell safely. They took the first two runs easily, but Raza wanted a third. Masakadza committed to the run straight away, but it was never on. Joyce's throw from the deep went to Porterfield at cover, who relayed it to the keeper, catching the batsman well short.
a length delivery is met with a dead bat from Panyangara
fuller this time, and Panyangara leans forward to drive to point.
a yorker on middle and off is dug out to mid-off, Panyangara survives.
short of a good length, Raza slaps it like a tennis forehand down to long-off.
nicely played by the tailender. He gets forward and drives with a straight bat to collect a single to mid-off's right.
smashed back at the bowler! I don't think he got a hand to it, though it was in the air. Just the single
in the air again! This was the leading edge now, and it popped up just past a diving fielder at short extra cover. They charge through for a single, and might have had an overthrow too.
clubbed down the ground again. O'Brien sticks out a boot, but he can't stop it and they take a single.

off the inside edge! Barely a ball has passed without drama in the last 10 minutes. Panyangara stepped forward and wanted to drive down the ground, but the ball flew off the inside edge and went to square leg instead.
a length delivery is tapped to mid-on, and there's no run there.
another dot. It's hard to see where the gap in the field is for Panyangara. He pushes this one to point and charges down the track, but Raza sends him back.
another dot ball, pressure builds. This was on a length outside off. Panyangara wanted the single to third man, but he found point instead.
wide ball! Murtagh shoots this one down the leg side. Panyangara aimed a Moin Khan-esque flick at it, but couldn't connect. Still, a run and an extra ball for Zimbabwe.
hit down the ground, but a diving mid-off cuts it off! That would have been the game, but it's just a single.
huge cheers erupt as Raza sends the ball down to third man with an angled bat.
what a way to finish the match! Panyangara steps down the track to meet the ball on the half volley,and crunches the ball straight down the ground for four! Scenes!
